body:
Comment 5 by **OlympusRunner**: 
This happened to me to. Maybe I used Mercurial incorrectly. When I did cd $GOROOT and hg
id, it cant find my id. When I run hg id in the actual directory I get the answer below.

Maybe my resolv.conf is incorrect... I have posted it all below...


test mime
test mime/multipart
test net
TEST FAIL net
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/dnukem/gotest/go/src/pkg/net'
gotest -test.short -test.timeout=120
rm -f _test/net.a
CGOPKGPATH= cgo --  cgo_linux.go cgo_unix.go
touch _obj/_cgo_run
6g  -o _gotest_.6 dial.go dnsmsg.go fd_linux.go hosts.go ip.go ipsock.go iprawsock.go
lookup.go net.go parse.go pipe.go sock.go tcpsock.go udpsock.go unixsock.go 
newpollserver.go fd.go file.go dnsconfig.go dnsclient.go port.go  _obj/cgo_linux.cgo1.go
_obj/cgo_unix.cgo1.go _obj/_cgo_gotypes.go dialgoogle_test.go dnsname_test.go
file_test.go hosts_test.go ip_test.go ipraw_test.go multicast_test.go net_test.go
parse_test.go pipe_test.go port_test.go server_test.go srv_test.go timeout_test.go
6c -FVw -I/home/dnukem/gotest/go/pkg/linux_amd64 -I . -o "_cgo_defun.6" _obj/_cgo_defun.c
gcc -m64 -I . -g -fPIC -O2 -o _cgo_main.o -c   _obj/_cgo_main.c
gcc -m64 -I . -g -fPIC -O2 -o cgo_linux.cgo2.o -c   _obj/cgo_linux.cgo2.c
gcc -m64 -I . -g -fPIC -O2 -o cgo_unix.cgo2.o -c   _obj/cgo_unix.cgo2.c
gcc -m64 -I . -g -fPIC -O2 -o _cgo_export.o -c   _obj/_cgo_export.c
gcc -m64 -g -fPIC -O2 -o _cgo1_.o _cgo_main.o cgo_linux.cgo2.o cgo_unix.cgo2.o
_cgo_export.o  
cgo -dynimport _cgo1_.o >_obj/_cgo_import.c_ && mv -f _obj/_cgo_import.c_
_obj/_cgo_import.c
6c -FVw -I . -o "_cgo_import.6" _obj/_cgo_import.c
rm -f _test/net.a
gopack grc _test/net.a _gotest_.6  _cgo_defun.6 _cgo_import.6 cgo_linux.cgo2.o
cgo_unix.cgo2.o _cgo_export.o
--- FAIL: net.TestICMP (0.02 seconds)
	net.WriteToIP(..., ::1) = 0, write ip ::1: non-IPv4 address
FAIL
gotest: "./6.out -test.short=true -test.timeout=120" failed: exit status 1
make[1]: *** [testshort] Error 2
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/dnukem/gotest/go/src/pkg/net'
make: *** [net.testshort] Error 1
dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go/src$ ls





dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go$ hg id
95d2ce135523 (release-branch.r57) release/release.r57.1


dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go$ cat /etc/*-release
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=9.10
DISTRIB_CODENAME=karmic
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 9.10"
dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go$ uname -mrs
Linux 2.6.31-23-generic x86_64


dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go$ 
dnukem@gs-laptop002:~/gotest/go$ cd $GOROOT
dnukem@gs-laptop002:~$ hg id
abort: there is no Mercurial repository here (.hg not found)
dnukem@gs-laptop002:~$ 



dnukem@gs-laptop002:~$ cat /etc/resolv.conf
# Generated by NetworkManager
domain Belkin
search Belkin
nameserver 192.168.2.1
